title.narrative: 2014 CHILD SURVIVAL INTERVENTIONS

description.narrative: By 2018, 60% of heath facilities provide an integrated care package for child survival in at least 5 provinces, which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Health â€“ General, Immunization, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2010-2018 - Outcome 2 / Health&Nutrition: By 2018, children and women benefit from prevention of chronic malnutrition through an integrated health and nutrition package, maternal and neonatal health and child survival.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2018, 60% of heath facilities provide an integrated care package for child survival in at least 5 provinces

description.narrative: UNICEF Burundi provided technical and financial support for the implementation of high-impact interventions for child survival in health facilities and at community level. As a result, about 650,000 children under five were assisted in 2018 and 43,000 were treated for severe acute malnutrition. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2018
